titleInfo.title: USA v. Grendahl
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Clarence James Grendahl. It is ordered that: (1) The government's request for hearing is granted; (2) A hearing on the government's motion for reduction of sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) 51 has been set before the undersigned United States district judge at 1:00 p.m., on Tuesday, October 11, 2005, in Courtroom No. 1, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska; (3) At the request of the defendant through his counsel, the defendant will participate in the hearing by telephone;(4) The Marshal is directed not to return the defendant to the district; and(5) The defendant is held to have waived his right to be present.***Rule 35 Motion Hearing set for 10/11/2005 01:00 PM in Courtroom 1 (Lincoln) before Judge Richard G. Kopf. Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 9/2/2005. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Grendahl
titleInfo.subTitle: AMENDED JUDGMENT in a Criminal Case on Motion of the Government After Initial Sentencing as to defendant Clarence James Grendahl (1). Government's motion (filing 51) for reduction of sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) is granted. The defendant's sentence of imprisonment is reduced from the original sentence to a term of forty-eight (48) months, followed by five (5) years supervised release with special conditions and pay restitution in the amount of $6,636.53($4,594.56 still due) and a $100 special assessment (PAID). Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 7/27/2006. (4 CC to USM) (JAR)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: AMENDED JUDGMENT in a Criminal Case on Motion of the Government After Initial Sentencing as to defendant Clarence James Grendahl (1). Government's motion (filing 51) for reduction of sentence pursuant to Rule 35(b) is granted. The defendant's sentence of imprisonment is reduced from the original sentence to a term of forty-eight (48) months, followed by five (5) years supervised release with special conditions and pay restitution in the amount of $6,636.53($4,594.56 still due) and a $100 special assessment (PAID). Signed by Judge Richard G. Kopf on 7/27/2006. (4 CC to USM) (JAR)
